conclusion: An ideal gas goes through states A, B, and C; temperature at A is 200 K; find temperature at C.
Diagram is a pressure-volume (p-V) diagram with points A, B, and C; pressures in 10^5 Pa, volumes in liters.
At point A: pressure is 1 x 10^5 Pa, volume is 2 L.
At point B: pressure is 4 x 10^5 Pa, volume is 2 L.
At point C: pressure is 1 x 10^5 Pa, volume is 5 L.
Use the ideal gas law: PV = nRT.
Calculate n using point A: n = (P_A * V_A) / (R * T_A).
Convert units: 1 bar = 1 x 10^5 Pa, 1 L = 0.001 m³.
Calculate n: n = 200 J / (8.314 J/(mol·K) * 200 K) ≈ 0.12 mol.
Find T_C using point C: T_C = (P_C * V_C) / (n * R).
Calculate T_C: T_C = 500 J / 1.00 J/K = 500 K.
Verify units: Pressure in Pa, volume in m³, temperature in K.
Consider cyclic process: net work done is zero.
